Understate: The claim may be understating the severity of the situation by stating that single-parent families earning the minimum wage will "live in poverty" without providing specific data or evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support in terms of specific data or evidence to show the correlation between the current minimum wage and single-parent families living in poverty in New Jersey.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that raising the minimum wage is the only solution to prevent single-parent families from living in poverty, without considering other factors or alternative solutions.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for single-parent families living in poverty in New Jersey, such as high living costs, lack of affordable housing, or limited job opportunities, which are not addressed in the claim.
